For me it’s generally because I want to be socially appropriate and polite. If I didn’t censor myself at times and instead just blurted out whatever I was feeling or thinking in a given situation, I might find myself in some trouble. Not wearing any type of facade would mean that I would be showing my true, unedited, unfiltered, real self in all social situations — and that wouldn’t go over so well for a multitude of reasons. The way I see it, we ALL have to wear a social facade (at times) in order to act appropriately. We all adjust our social selves in response to changing social situations. We all routinely and regularly act in ways which we don’t feel or say things which we don’t mean or hide things which we feel all in the name of being socially appropriate. Showe me a person who does not wear a facade from time to time and you’d likely be showing me a person who has no friends and not much of a social life.
